name: Preacher Curls
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a flat bench or chair with your torso resting against the backrest.
2. Place one arm behind you for support, holding onto the backrest or a stable object to keep your body straight and in position.

Ensure that the top of your shoulder is aligned with the edge of the bench.
3. Hold the dumbbell or barbell in your free hand with your palm facing forward.

4. Slowly curl the weight up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm still against your body.

5. Focus on squeezing your biceps muscle at the top of the movement and holding for a brief moment before lowering.
6. Repeat the movement by reversing the direction, slowly lowering the dumbbell to the starting position while maintaining control throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Preacher curls are an isolation exercise that specifically targets the biceps muscles in the upper arms.
